author: J R
text:
‘Neo-liberal forces are getting aggressive in India and other countries’

The time is ripe for launching a mass movement involving students, who are looking united despite political differences, against neo-liberal forces, Jawaharlal Nehru University Students Union leader Kanhaiya Kumar has said.

Speaking to The Hindu here on Friday, Mr. Kumar said earlier the students unions in universities were controlled by political parties and were acting as cadre-generating platforms. “Not anymore. One cannot segregate students from realpolitik in a democratic system as all decisions are taken in Parliament, and education is not an exception.”

Mr. Kumar said universities were centres to promote critical thinking. “There is an allegation that we are indulging in politics. Who is indulging in politics, we or the government? It (the government) has a script to destroy the autonomy of universities. The motto of universities, intellectuals is to promote critical thinking,” he said.

He said there were several movements taking place in India and elsewhere. The neo-liberal forces are getting aggressive. “The fine example is Donald Trump, the presidential candidate of the U.S. His policies could be dangerous,” Mr Kumar said. The concept of a welfare state was gradually being demolished and the repercussions were felt by students as well. “This is not just happening in India — it is a world phenomenon.”

Neo-liberal forces getting aggressive in India and other countries, says the student leader
title: Time ripe for a mass movement, says Kanhaiya
